Any Python object that implements a suitable __await__ method.

Some examples of operations that satisfy one or more of the above conditions:

Model load operations, see async-loading.

messenger.future('event'), to suspend the coroutine until an event is fired from outside the coroutine.

tex.prepare() <.Texture.prepare>, to wait for a texture to finish uploading to the graphics card. The returned value is the prepared .TextureContext object.

cpp

Panda3D provides the .AsyncFuture class to represent an operation that is currently underway. Any operation that returns this class is considered an asynchronous operation.

Experimental feature

As of Panda3D 1.10, this is still an experimental feature, and some behavior may change in future versions. The upcoming version of Panda3D, 1.11, will improve support for cancellation of futures in particular.
